synopsis: In episode #7 of 'Pineapple Plant Rotation', hosts Devam and Ahir delve into the complexities of self-judgment, pain, and personal growth. They share their experiences of navigating relationships, emotional turmoil, and the journey towards self-acceptance, encouraging listeners to embrace their vulnerabilities and foster genuine connections.
quotes: I always wait too long to do every single thing.
You can only really do one thing at a time.
Accepting your pain is a crucial step in your journey of self-growth.
You can't control how people see you; you need to trust the people who are right for you.
Self-judgment kept me from being honest about who I really was.
Sometimes, I'll just cry for hours, and it feels like a weight has been lifted.
You can't heal everybody; you can't please everybody.
Life can only be lived forwards, but can only be understood backwards.
You need to allow yourself to be weak to see your limitations.
You can run from your pain, but that doesn't mean it will go away.
